Detailed Description

Defines an entry in a simple translation table.

Each entry defines a mapping from one virtual page to one physical page. In addition, there are some extra bits for access control (valid and read-only) and some bits for usage information (use and dirty).

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

PageTableEntry::PageTableEntry (   ) 
 

By default, a new page table entry refers to a page not on disk neither in swap or physical mem: page is considered unmapped

Member Data Documentation

int PageTableEntry::addrDisk
 

Depending on the 'swap' bit:

  • swap == true : location, in terms of PAGES, in the swap
  • swap == false: location, in terms of BYTES, from the beginning of the executable file, or -1 for anonymous mapping

bool PageTableEntry::io
 

This bit is set by the system every time the page is occupied in a input-output.

short int PageTableEntry::physicalPage
 

The page number in real memory (relative to the start of "mainMemory"). Relevant when valid is true only !

bool PageTableEntry::readAllowed
 

Access rights to the page. If some of these flags are set, the user is allowed to perform the corresponding operations (read/write) over the whole page. If none of these flags is set, then the page is considered not available at all, and any access to the page leads to an AddressErrorException Allows program to read the page contents

bool PageTableEntry::swap
 

If this bit is set, the page must be load from swap. If not, the page must be load from executable file.

bool PageTableEntry::valid
 

If this bit isn't set, then the page is not in physical memory.

bool PageTableEntry::writeAllowed
 

Allows program to modify the page contents
